text: This photo here is addressing a situation we need to address in this discussion: who benefits from public investment. Here, what used to be Brevard Street and the 300 and 400 blocks in Brooklyn that were cleared in 1949 for Independence Blvd is where this discussion should start!
text_html: This photo here is addressing a situation we need to address in this discussion: who benefits from public investment. Here, what used to be Brevard Street and the 300 and 400 blocks in Brooklyn that were cleared in 1949 for Independence Blvd is where this discussion should start!

text: Commitment from taxpayers that it’s a priority.
text_html: Commitment from taxpayers that it’s a priority.

text:
That much of the loss of equity that would have created home ownership and wealth wasn't an accident.
Urban renewal and red-lining stole millions, if not billions, of wealth from our neighbors.
Give them what was stolen, and they can afford housing.
There are records.
text_html: That much of the loss of equity that would have created home ownership and wealth wasn't an accident. Urban renewal and red-lining stole millions, if not billions, of wealth from our neighbors. Give them what was stolen, and they can afford housing. There are records.

text:
The NCGA should expand the options to municipalities. Each city, town, village in NC is unique. Local authority would benefit from more mechanisms to craft a solution to address a specific municipalities needs.

The @nclm should be included on your panel.
